721016f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 49th Street
721016f-a.text:

P.L. Sperr,Photographer.  October 29, 1927.

713379f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street - Lexington Avenue
713379f-a.text:
49th Street, north side, from Lexington to Park Avenues. The Adams Express Company on Lexington Avenue has already been demolished, and the power plant in the centre of this picture will soon go to
malo way for the new Waldorf-Astoria Hotel.
July 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr..

713378f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street - Lexington Avenue
713378f-a.text:
49th Street, north side, west from but not including Lexington
Astoria Hotel.
March 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

721013f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 49th Street (East)
721013f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, south from E. 49th Street, as viewed from the Hotel Beverly at the N. E. corner of 50th Street. Constructional details seen are for the new Waldorf-Astoria. Across same eppears the 14 story Barclay. This is at the S. W. corner. Above this is the towering Grand Central Building. To the left of the latter are the dim outlines of the Lincoln
and the Chanin Buildings.
May 3, 1930
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

721013f-b.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 49th Street (East)
721013f-b.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, south from E. 49th Street, as viewed from the Hotel Beverly at the N. E. corner of 50th Street. Constructional details seen are for the new Waldorf-Astoria. Across same eppears the 14 story Barclay. This is at the S. W. corner. Above this is the towering Grand Central Building. To the left of the latter are the dim outlines of the Lincoln
and the Chanin Buildings.
May 3, 1930
P. L. Sperr  Views 1,2

721018f-a.title: Manhattan: Lexington Avenue - 49th Street
721018f-a.text:
Lexington Avenue, west side, from 49th to 50th Streets, showing the upper end of the Grand Central railroad yards in the block where the new Hotel Walcorf-nstoria is being erected. The cars in the right foreground are directly below the site of the Adams Express Building, which has just been demolished. The rest of the block was occupied by the railroad power plant and Y. M. C. A.
March 4, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

713377f-a.title: Manhattan: 49th Street (East) - Lexington Avenue
713377f-a.text:
144-150 East 49th Street, south side, between Lexington and
Third Avenues.
About 1924.
Underwood & Underwood.
Gift of E. M. Jenks.
